TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GuidConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a GUID object to and from a string.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
> [!CAUTION] > You should never create an instance of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.GuidConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
## Examples The following code example converts a variable of type <xref:System.Guid> to a string, and vice versa.
[!code-cpp[Converters#13](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#13)] [!code-csharp[Converters#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#13)] [!code-vb[Converters#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#13)]

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you wish to convert from.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the given source type to a GUID object using the context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a GUID object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value);

Docs.summary: Converts the given object to a GUID object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a GUID object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: The culture into which value will be converted.
The type to convert the object to.
Docs.summary: Converts the given object to another type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The most common types to convert are to and from a string object. The default implementation will make a call to <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> on the object if the object is valid and if the destination type is `string`.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
